content.description: Climb the vertical hand and fist crack on good rock 35 feet to the top.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5 or 4".  Rap off trees or hike over to the walkdown behind the Throne Proper.
content.location: Left around the corner from the Throne Proper, this is the hand and fist crack.

content.description: Climb the face about 15 feet to obtain a horizontal crack and the thin vertical crack system.  Follow it to the anchors.
content.location: This is the thin crack splitting the face just right of Fun Alley Wall, at the far left end of the Blind Man's Bluff area.

climbs.name: Exit Left
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbee, Jon Von Canan, Chuck Foster 1989

content.description: Climb through a series of featured horizontal cracks interspersed with crimps on the face.  Arrive at the bolt near a left trending ramp and pick your poison: left, right, or striaght up.  After navigating the blank section, scramble up on easier terrain to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3" and one bolt.
content.location: Starts ten feet right of the large pine at the base of the wall.  Look for a bolt near the left angling weakness at two thirds height.

content.description: Start with a short boulder problem up to a large ledge. Then follow the shallow dihedral crack to the top.
content.location: 30 feet to the left of Too Thick to Navigate.

content.description: Climb the dihedral and crack on decent rock, going over or around a death boulder at the top.
content.protection: Gear to 4".  Rap off trees or hike to the walkdown on the White Trash Wall.
content.location: At the left end of the Blind Man's Bluff area, just right around the corner from Fun Alley Wall.  This is the large crack in the dihedral.

content.description: Great technical face climbing and challenging route finding. Mostly decent crimps and a couple of brilliant pockets! Climb up over a slabby ledge and trend right over easy terrain to anchors. Some holds can be a bit difficult to find, but good holds are definitely there. Crux up high and maybe a bit heady down low. The site of the first bolt ever put up at Sam's with an interesting essay in Cole Fennel's 2nd Ed. Arkansas guidebook.
content.protection: Mostly finger sized gear (.3-.5 C4/X4) and few alpine draws. Guidebook reccomends a #6, but is not necessary with horizontal finger-sized pieces. A single bolt protects up high and a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: The route is just climber's left of a pine tree down the small hill of the wall the wall that makes up the left side of the scramble to the top of the Throne.

content.description: Animal Crackers begins in a slightly overhanging finger crack. After about 15 feet, you arrive at the left angling ramp of a route called Catwalk. From the ramp, sustained 5.9 face climbing with pro in horizontal cracks leads to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack. (The smallest piece I placed was a yellow TCU and the largest was a #3 C4). Don't skip any obvious gear placements, because they are spaced out. I got 4 pieces on this route. They were all good, but there weren't other options. 2-bolt anchor at top.
content.location: When facing "Sonya, Tonya. What's the difference?" on the Throne proper, turn around 180 degrees. Animal Crackers is on this face, left of a huge brown streak. You will see it intersecting the obvious left leaning ramp of Catwalk.

content.description: Northeast facing, good quality sandstone.  This area continues around the corner all the way to the slabby Fun Alley Wall.
